website_summaries.verdict: A true bargain offering many of the features of higher-end models at a greatly reduced price.
pros: Durable steel construction, large fuel tank, quick-start guide, covered outlets, and weight of 171 pounds make this generator ideal for outdoor recreational activities
Two 120-volt outlets, one twist lock outlet, circuit breakers, and low oil detector offer flexibility and help ensure a long life
cons: Will power most of your essentials, but always check your individual appliance ratings to be sure

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in quality control. I received the generator on 5/6/17. I filled the gas tank on 5/7/17 and inspected the generator before starting it and noticed the carburetor seal was incorrectly seated at the factory, See pictures. It aggravates me that I have to take the air filter off to fix a new generator that I paid $498 for.
customer_reviews.author: IDS5

customer_reviews.title: Great work generator
customer_reviews.text: I bought this generator to power a build I was doing at a remote site that didn't have power. Typically ran equipment (saw, compressor, etc) battery charger, fan, and plug in cooler. I've used it in a pinch when the power went. This unit is fairly loud but it works. I've had over 100 hours on it and it is running fine. It is stored inside a shed with ethanol free gas and the gas line closed. It starts on the first pull with the choke on. Happy with my purchase. I would hope that they would include better nuts and bolts as the vibration has rattled many of them out.
customer_reviews.author: That guy again

customer_reviews.title: Strong and does excellent job! Low noise as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Strong and does excellent job! Low noise as advertised. It fits well under neath in your garage. I am grateful that my husband got rid of his old one because it was very noisy. What a difference, excellent quality!
customer_reviews.author: Lexy

customer_reviews.title: gopherturkey
customer_reviews.text: We used this generator for the first time during the two and a half day power outage from a late October Noreaster here in Mass. It worked as advertised-a little noisy but that was only when being in the house nearest to the genrator's location outside. The electrician had come and wired for a lot of things to go on. While many did,but not all. we need to redo the priority list, but that has nothing to do with the generator-it worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: turkeygopher

customer_reviews.title: Met my expectations
customer_reviews.text: While I haven't used this generator for an extended period of time, thus far it appears to be exactly as advertised. One problem in previous reviews was a leaking carburetor. After running mine on 3 different occasions, NO LEAKS. Found the unit to start on the first pull, runs semi-quietly, and the power output seems very steady at 120/240V. Shipping company was very helpful in delivering the unit by providing a power tailgate lift (this weighs about 190 lbs). it was delivered before promised date, and assembly took just a few minutes. Oil was provided for the engine. While I hope I don't need this too often, I believe it will work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: LMB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Generator works great and was powerful enough for everything I need. Not as heavy as a expected either.
customer_reviews.author: Brody fuller

customer_reviews.title: Very good. Just need better design for easier maintenance
customer_reviews.text: It does it's job. Hope they design it for an easier fuel drainage like a 3 way stopcock where an extra fuel line can be attached for external drainage.
customer_reviews.author: RCM

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! Starts on the first pull each time! Highly recommend this generator!
customer_reviews.author: CHARLENE VANNAH

customer_reviews.title: Recent purchase
customer_reviews.text: Received my Generac about 3 weeks ago...easy assembly...started on the 2nd pull. Nice machine, easy to maneuver and quieter than I thought. Purchase was easy and no hassles whatsoever. Having it hooked up this week and will be storm-ready. Smart purchase and inexpensive insurance!
customer_reviews.author: F. Bruneau

customer_reviews.title: well made, built to last, easy to assemble and runs great
customer_reviews.text: no issues with delivery, easy to put together and started right up....not too loud and looks really well made...shocked we did not have a power outage this winter with all the snow in Boston so have not had a chance to use, but I don't imagine I'm going to have any issues as it starts on the first pull and has all the bells and whistles I need...very pleased with this unit
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and operate
customer_reviews.text: This generator has great reviews on several sites, including a recommendation from Consumer Reports. I found it very easy to set up--it only required bolting on the wheels and handle, and adding oil and gas (and I do recommend reading the manual before trying to use it to supply power to anything). The engine started on the first pull--impressive, for an engine that has never run before. I checked polarity and grounding on all plugs (all were correct), but have yet to put a load on the generator. That may wait until I install a transfer switch or interlock switch on my home electrical panel.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: READY FOR OUTAGES.
customer_reviews.text: One of best generators on market for fair price. It's like car insurance, you want a really good product but hope it's never needed!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Hardly used. Will not start.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in 2012. This review written on 8/17/2020. Used it twice. Less than 10 hours on it. Would not start on yearly maintenance startup, i.e., cord would not pull. Dropped off at Generac approved service shop. Mechanic said engine timing issue and would need to spend more time on diagnostics than generator is worth. I told him keep it for parts and will buy a new one, not Generac.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great Generator
customer_reviews.text: I love this generator. Power went out just after I got it and it ran great. Not too loud but a little bit on the noisy side. Compared to my neighbor's though it whispers.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Great power - we keep it especially for when we have power outages (keeps our refrigerators running, and will use it if a disastrous earthquake strikes. It's a safety must.
customer_reviews.author: Georgie Girl

customer_reviews.title: what i wanted
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly as I wanted it to do. And it was the noise level advertised based on my testing
customer_reviews.author: paul a/v

customer_reviews.title: It serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Generac is supposed to be one of the best in the business, but this generator came with a fuel leak and I had trouble getting people to come to my house for warranty service.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth D

customer_reviews.title: good generator
customer_reviews.text: Its Heavy, runs good, and handles our household needs when the power is out. I wish it had additional outlets.
customer_reviews.author: Firetruck86

customer_reviews.title: Junk at this point
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item in Sept of 2012. Only ran a few times and has 55 hours on it. I have started it every few months for three years and have completed all maint. required. Recently I started the unit with no problem but it would not put oput any electric power. I brought it to an authirized repair center and they told me the electrical side of the unit was burned out and that the unit parts and labor would cost $500.00 to repair . At this point the unit is junk Im going to try and contact Amazon and Generac to see if I can get some help with this. IT SHOULD LAST FOR YEARS NOT 55 HOURS.
customer_reviews.author: C. Norton

customer_reviews.title: N/A
customer_reviews.text: This item was as described - arrived on time in very good condition - put oil and gas in generator nand pulled - it started rightm up and sounds good - will use this site again
customer_reviews.author: Bettina Michael

customer_reviews.title: Just the Volvo of generators
customer_reviews.text: We never had a problem with Generac generators on the jobsite, Always reliable, pretty decent prices (if you want a cheapo, you'll get what you pay for) and the ability to do the job day in, day out. It's not as pretty as some of the other brands but it does what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy Old Dude

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line generator
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, comes with a quart of oil; put it together, add oil & gas, started on the second pull.
customer_reviews.author: Philip E Barrell

customer_reviews.title: Consumer Reports got this one rated perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This generator started on the 2nd pull out of the box and ran perfectly, I was so impressed with this machine I bought one for my Son for Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: This was a Consumer Reports best buy and so far has lived up to it's rating. Shipping was easy and was packed well - arrived without any damage. Easy to set up and runs perfectly. I would absolutely recommend this to a friend
customer_reviews.author: Patrick O’Neill

customer_reviews.title: starts easy, wish it had electric start
customer_reviews.text: Works well, starts easy, wish it had electric start, can not add later
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: as good as Consumer Rpt rates
customer_reviews.text: Super fantastic. Easy to put wheels and handle on.Put oil in; cranked first pull. Smooth running; heavy duty construction; very good quality. I have 10 yr Generac Back for my farm house; never a problem. Very good value for any price.
customer_reviews.author: richard perez

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: The delivery person hand trucked the generator in to my garage, within the delivery window. Assembly was easy, added oil and gas, started on the second pull. Very happy with the product and delivery. Thanks Amazon.com!
customer_reviews.author: D. Baer

customer_reviews.title: Good standby power insurance to keep house running.
customer_reviews.text: It starts easy and performs as expected. Luckily I haven't needed it yet, but this year the forecast is bad.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Pennsylvania Rain
customer_reviews.text: This is a just what we needed! With the rain and flooding we had here, this gives me a peace of mind, Since we have a sump pump. I no longer have the worries like I use to have.
customer_reviews.author: gemini4life

customer_reviews.title: Generac 5939 GP5500
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to use this "real-time," but feel better already that we have it in case we lose power due to the flooded Missouri. We've always talked about getting a generator anyway. We were able to put the parts together quickly and it started right up. The free shipping made it one of the best prices we could find.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: easy start .  .
customer_reviews.text: STARTED ON THE FIRST PULL RIGHT OUT OF THE BOX AFTER ADDING OIL AND GAS. RAN SMOOTH A LITTLE NOISY. BUT SATISFIED.
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE MOYER

customer_reviews.title: No handles deliveed
customer_reviews.text: The handles for one the generator are missing which is unacceptable i just started setting up
customer_reviews.author: chris carey

customer_reviews.title: Very Sound Generator.  Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit from Lowe’s. I bought it mainly to run a 110 wire welder. I ran my Numbers and came in good bit below the actual rated capacity of the generator. I did have to slow the wire speed a little bit but the welder did a great job of powering this welder in the field. I pulled the generator out of the box, checked all components, added oil and put in gas. On the 2nd pull it fired right up and ran perfect. Since then it starts on the 1st pull every time. So far I am very pleased with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P

customer_reviews.title: Perfect generator for an average home
customer_reviews.text: 2017. This thing is an animal. Bought it since we live in the mountains. Powers our 2000 sq ft house (with turning lights off in rooms we arent using). Powers the well, water heater, all tvs at once, fridge, lights at will, fishtank and furnace. I use the twistlock plug and backfeed the whole house (TURNING OFF MAIN BREAKER on panel when using generator) I also use it to provide customers power when rewiring their house. A+ Generac generators are THE generators to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ty K

customer_reviews.title: Think of passing on this generator
customer_reviews.text: Used about 4 times, stored as directed (drained and out of the weather), pain in the butt to start but doesn't stay running. Tried everything listed off the web and YouTube, bought a new carburetor, fuel lines, filter...EVERYTHING! When I called customer support I relayed everything I did and they said that's all that they would have told me to do. They just suggested that I take it to a repair shop. Hmmm...everything on this machine is basically new because I've replaced everything. I'm looking into something reliable...sadly wanted to buy American but very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: B. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: After 1 year and 6hrs total run time....product quality issues
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit for a year, exercising it a half hour a month. After the first 2 hours the exhaust side tire started to get deformed. A little later a small nut fell out of the unit, after an hour of looking, I never located the source. At the 5 hour mark, the run time meter stopped working. During sart-up today (less than 6hrs) the on/off selector switch just fell apart. Fortunately, it's a normally open switch, so the unit started. I always close the fuel valve to achieve shutdown anyway, just aggravated that a $700+ piece of equipment has such cheap components....
customer_reviews.author: Ron Grant

customer_reviews.title: It ran like crap, cutting out three times and when it ...
customer_reviews.text: Ran my generator tonight because of a power failure. It ran like crap, cutting out three times and when it idled it couldn't keep a constant rpm. I always run my the unit out of gas before storing in my garage, and I always use fresh gas with stabilizer. I guess it time to look at the float issue since my air filter has gasoline on it. I am not a happy camper especially since I only have maybe ten hours on the unit. I also notice that the generator quits when the tank gets to half full figure that out??? Generac I am certainly not happy with your product...
customer_reviews.author: BobBee

customer_reviews.title: DISPOSABLE GENERATOR !!! USE IT ONCE AND THROW IT AWAY.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this GP 5500 and was very impressed with it during one storm that came though (less than 10 hrs on the hour meter). Now I'm sitting in my home without a generator because it wont produce electricity. Brand new generator and no power. I called Generac and they gave me the run around. I guess all they do is sell expensive generators then your on your own. I think I paid over $700.00+ for it. That equals out to more than 70$ an hour that I paid out per hour of use. DISPOSABLE GENERATOR !!! USE IT ONCE AND THROW IT AWAY.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Generac is a rip-off!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy a Generac GP5500!. You will get a gas leak from the carb and they will not warranty. it is easy to fix and someone on youtube posted how to fix but the problem will recur over and over. Generac knows this is a bad carb problem by the manufacturer but refuse to help customers.Do yourself a favor and stay away from a Generac.
customer_reviews.author: efan478

customer_reviews.title: cheap fuel tank leads to short machine life
customer_reviews.text: I've had this generator for 5 years now. Every time I have gone to start it, there have been problems. I've used fuel stabilizer because its sits for long periods between use, but the carburetor needs cleaning every time I try to start it. The fuel tank is made from very cheap steel and has totally rusted on the inside. Chunks of rust held the float open and flooded the crankcase last time, and the corrosion is so bad, its basically unusable. The lack of access to the insides of the tank make cleaning impossible. It is frustrating to have a motor in good shape but know that if I add fuel, the carburetor will clog.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine Vogt

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and finicky
customer_reviews.text: Bought mine right after sandy and no power for 2 wks. A year later dead battery. After that I ran it monthly to keep battery strong. 3 yrs later battery dead and starter. Luckily I have not needed it but I have my doubts about it's reliability. Should have sprung for the Honda generator. Generac had mixed reviews and I took a chance. Bad choice. U will spend more servicing than using.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GP 5500 fuel fix
customer_reviews.text: Repaired fuel problem of GP 5000 by converting to LP gas.. That carb is trash.. Motor starts every time and no worries of fire from leaking fuel or vanishing.. Bought LP kit from US Carburetor on line.. Easy add on to install.. Also installed a tach..
customer_reviews.author: melbe1787

customer_reviews.title: Not the same Generac of the past
customer_reviews.text: I bought this same unit locally at a price a little higher than Amazon but I needed it right away. In the second hour I noticed a gas smell and upon investigation I saw gas leaking out of the carb and all over my patio. While fixing that myself I noticed the lousy quality of cast parts typical of being made in China. A month later the pull cord broke and I returned the unit for another brand. Generac has gone down the dumper.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M. Sartori

customer_reviews.title: I must have gotten the best one. No trouble
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for years. I must have gotten the best one. No trouble whatsoever
customer_reviews.author: OBDEWL'L. X

customer_reviews.title: Works well in Puerto Rico
customer_reviews.text: I bought this generator in Puerto Rico in Nov. 2017, about two months after hurricane Maria. No problems to report. Read all the instructions and follow them completely. Don't understand the negative reviews. Do people read now a days or is it just easier to complain instead of reading and following instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Magali Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Would not work from the start
customer_reviews.text: Engine worked fine, but no power would generate. When you pay that kind of money to expect it to work or at least someone at factory test it??????
customer_reviews.author: spike

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding during initial use
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these during Hurricane Sandy's aftermath. It ran most of my house, including the heat. A full tank ran literally all night. The noise level and fumes are comparable to other portable generators. I've only had it a few days, but initial quality is great (so no comment on the reviewers who had it for a year and then experienced problems). This has performed well through one big storm, and in NJ we're expecting more, so hopefully it will continue.
customer_reviews.author: brightersuns

customer_reviews.title: Same engine as cheapy generators that cost half as much
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaint about the generator other then the engine is made in an " unknown private overseas vender" (china??). Look at some pics, the gp5500 has the same engine found in all the cheap chinease generators that cost half as much. I am really upset that i spent $780.00 w/tax for this generator from GENERAC! only to find out later its a cheap generator like a chicago, champion, homelite etc. I bought it because it was a generac and it was suppossed to be made in america = quality. I could have spent half the money and gotten the same product that was not hiding behind a name that used to be known for amarican quality.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Got me through Sandy
customer_reviews.text: I was out of power for 10 days. I did not run constantly however I must have put on 200 hours. It ran flawlessly the whole time.
customer_reviews.author: L from NJ

customer_reviews.title: just got it
customer_reviews.text: well havent had to use it yet , just wanted to chime in on the LOUD issue, I read one review by some one who said much quieter than my old B&S storm responder and I whole hardedly agree. those who think this one is load , should compare it to some other , lesser expense generators, not the high end ones, ths one is quiet enough for me, also nice that my wife can start it if Im not around, she never could start the storm responder , another strike against that one,ths one starts easy one first or second pull and powers the whole house,
customer_reviews.author: LarryB

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: I had mine now for 4 years n so far no leaks n works like a champ
customer_reviews.author: Miller 04

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for the power
customer_reviews.text: Thiis is a great unit, it runs right out of the box, it delivers power, it has wheels. Not sure how it ages but we will see. Good buy. Well made. Weighsc180 pounds. Thank you generac. And thank you lowes for not price gouging during tough times
customer_reviews.author: sanford link

customer_reviews.title: Lou
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these Generac GP5500 generators during hurricane Sandy. When trouble-shooting stale gasoline, I noticed that other generators had a gas filter. Mine does not. I call the company customer service, who told me i'd have to go buy one myself, even after I explained that mine never had one. The supervisor said she would check with headquarters to see what they could do, and call me back. Of course i never heard back from her. If they balk over a 5 dollar filter, I can imagine what their response would be if something more expensive failed. I just bought two Honda EU2000's and I will NEVER never purchase anything again from generac.
customer_reviews.author: Louis E. Hightower

customer_reviews.title: I think a recall of this faulty product needs to ...
customer_reviews.text: I think a recall of this faulty product needs to happen...
customer_reviews.author: Marie Tillman

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy it!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: You'll waste more money in getting in fixed then it actually working. Leaks gas all over can cause fire. Had it serviced and they said my gas is bad and called customer service and no one else has complained. Don't waste your time with this company.
customer_reviews.author: PSticky

product_meta.title: Generac 5939 GP5500 5500 Running Watts/6875 Starting Watts Gas Powered Portable Generator
product_meta.description: Power the fun stuff or cover an emergency with a Generac GP Series portable generator. Generac's model 5939, GP5500 is ideal for tailgating, camping, power tool use, and emergency home backup power. It has a low-tone muffler for quieter operation and an hour meter that tracks usage between maintenance sessions. The low oil shutdown feature detects low oil levels and if found, shuts down the engine to prevent any damage. The unique fold down hands and never flat wheels allow for extreme portability, and the heavy duty hardened steel tube cradle gives the generator extra strength and durability. The new covered circuit breaker protected outlets provide added protection from the environment and rugged working conditions. Affordable reliability and features not usually found on basic portable models makes these units a favorite for home use, camping, job sites or outdoor events. Model 5939 is not CARB (can not ship to state of California) or CSA compliant.
feature_bullets: Generac 389cc OHV engine for long engine life and consistent power
Hour Meter / Low-oil level shutdown / Covered, circuit breaker outlets for added protection
7.2 gallons fuel tank provides up to 10 hours of run time at 50% load
Fold-down, locking handle provides compact storage while heavy-duty, never flat wheels offers reliable portability
Hardened 1 1/4" steel tube cradle for added strength and durability

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars119 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
